title: Predict: Logistic Regression Decision Boundary
story: Logistic regression predicts class 1 if probability > 0.5. This happens when the linear combination (z) is > 0.
instructions: Predict class for input. Given coef=[1, -2], intercept=1, input=[3, 1]. Calculate z = coef·x + intercept. Print 1 if z>0 else 0.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

coef = np.array([1, -2])
intercept = 1
x = np.array([3, 1])

# Calculate linear combination
z = np.dot(coef, x) + intercept

# Decision boundary: z > 0 → class 1
if z > 0:
    print(1)
else:
    print(0)

tests.expectedBehavior: Calculate z and apply decision boundary

hints.text: Logistic regression: z > 0 → sigmoid(z) > 0.5 → predict class 1
